entry.title: LoaF: Improve Trace Events for DevTools use cases
entry.content:
We had a sync w/DevTools team and we think long animation frames could be the model for the frames track in devtools (for main thread). Keeping this separate from issue 41492055 for now since there could be differences in DevTools needs vs chrometto needs, but open to merging.
The team would like the following: * P0: All long frames are reported as trace events. Right now we only have trace events above the threshold. * P0: Timings should not be rounded in trace events as they are in web-exposed APIs. @nrosenthal@chromium.org: the timings are coarsened in the web API layer so there's nothing to do here, correct? * P2: presentation timestamps. * P2: breakdowns. Currently we have `duration`, `blockingDuration`, `renderDuration`, `styleAndLayoutDuration`, and `numScripts`. Some things we could do:
a. Report start/end times as well: `RenderStartTime`, `StyleAndLayoutStartTime`, `FirstUIEventTime`. See [`AnimationFrameTimingInfo`](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/timing/animation_frame_timing_info.h;l=96;drc=2a5aaed0ff3a0895c8551495c2656ed49baf742c;bpv=1;bpt=1) for everything that could be reported.
b. Report additional info for scripts beyond `numScripts` from [`ScriptTimingInfo`](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/timing/animation_frame_timing_info.h;l=96;drc=2a5aaed0ff3a0895c8551495c2656ed49baf742c;bpv=1;bpt=1): `invoker_type`, `start_time`, `execution_start_time`, `end_time`, `style_duration`, `layout_duration`, `class_like_name`, `property_like_name`.
c. Report info as in (b), but also for scripts < 5ms, which aren't reported in the API.
@paulirish@chromium.org @bckenny would like your thoughts on which of the above would be useful here!
Assigning this to myself to work on.

entry.title: Chrome no longer loads opensc-pkcs11 and smartcards won't work
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Try and use a smarcard with Chrome on Linux
# Problem Description Prior to version 123 a smartcard worked fine by adding the opensc-pkcs11 library to the NSS database. Now with version 123 my smartcard is no longer read and I see that it's no longer loaded.
>modutil -list -dbdir .pki/nssdb
Listing of PKCS #11 Modules ----------------------------------------------------------- 1. NSS Internal PKCS #11 Module uri: pkcs11:library-manufacturer=Mozilla%20Foundation;library-description=NSS%20Internal%20Crypto%20Services;library-version=3.98 slots: 2 slots attached status: loaded
slot: NSS Internal Cryptographic Services token: NSS Generic Crypto Services uri: pkcs11:token=NSS%20Generic%20Crypto%20Services;manufacturer=Mozilla%20Foundation;serial=0000000000000000;model=NSS%203
slot: NSS User Private Key and Certificate Services token: NSS Certificate DB uri: pkcs11:token=NSS%20Certificate%20DB;manufacturer=Mozilla%20Foundation;serial=0000000000000000;model=NSS%203
2. Mozilla Root Certs library name: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/nss/libnssckbi.so slots: There are no slots attached to this module status: Not loaded
3. CAC Module library name: /usr/lib/pkcs11/libcoolkeypk11.so slots: There are no slots attached to this module status: Not loaded

entry.content:
Just a minor bug fix release.
https://chromium.googlesource.com/webm/libwebp/+log/v1.3.2..v1.4.0 (tag pending) https://chromium.googlesource.com/webm/libwebp/+log/v1.3.2..v1.4.0-rc1 https://crbug.com/webp/627
- 4/2/2024: version 1.4.0 This is a binary compatible release. * API changes: - libwebpmux: WebPAnimEncoderSetChunk, WebPAnimEncoderGetChunk, WebPAnimEncoderDeleteChunk - libsharpyuv: SharpYuvOptionsInit, SharpYuvConvertWithOptions - extras: SharpYuvEstimate420Risk * further security related hardening in libwebp & examples * some minor optimizations in the lossless encoder * improvements and corrections in webp-container-spec.txt and webp-lossless-bitstream-spec.txt (#611) * miscellaneous warning, bug & build fixes (#615, #619, #632, #635)

entry.title: Have a good way to serialize protobufs
More recent Android U releases show up as Android A
entry.content:
The GPU team is currently qualifying Android U for our Pixel 6 devices. We've had some stability issues that we thought might be related to the specific image being used on the devices, so we've tried several different ones to see if the issues go away.
Devices with [older](https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/bot?id=lin-123-e505--device3) images properly report in swarming and in GPU tests as running Android U, e.g. `U | UQ1A.240105.002` in swarming and the `android-u` tag gets produced in tests. However, devices with the [newer](https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/bot?id=lin-29-e505--device1) images report `A | AP1A.240405.002` and produce `android-a` tags.
Based on the naming from the [publicly available images](https://developers.google.com/android/images#oriole), this is an intentional change, as there are multiple releases for multiple devices with this name change. However, it's not a case of the actual Android version changing much, as they're still reported as being Android 14 images.

entry.title: content does not animate with window on requestFullscreen()
entry.content:
To repro:
1. Open https://eggplant-comet-pot.glitch.me/ in a window that's smaller than the whole screen (this makes it easier to observe the bug) 2. Click the "Fullscreen" button in the page 3. Observe that the content immediately jumps to the full size of the screen, while the workspace animates behind it.
Further,
4. Exit fullscreen by pressing "Esc" 5. Observe that the content immediately jumps to its original size, but a second copy of the window animates behind it from fullscreen size down to the original size.
These glitches aren't observed when using the green "zoom" button on the window controls to enter/exit fullscreen.
Version: 123.0.6312.107 (Official Build) (arm64) macOS Version 14.3.1 (Build 23D60)

entry.title: Chrome Skia Gold instance doesn't handle multilogin or non-corp accounts well
entry.content:
Sven, I don't know whom to assign this to (or what component to use), so hoping you can triage.
I have a Chrome profile with the following GAIA IDs logged in, in this order: (0) pkasting@chromium.org (Chromium; corp-linked) (1) zerodpx@gmail.com (personal) (2) pkasting@google.com (corp)
Steps to repro on my profile: (1) Clear all cookies (2) Visit https://chrome-gold.skia.org/detail?grouping=name%3DCR2023_InteractionTestUtilBrowserTest_CompareScreenshot_Surface_EntireAppMenu_5406870_windows%26source_type%3Dgtest-pixeltests&digest=5ff7f3ab128955c37af1b269b274fc9e&changelist_id=5427510&crs=gerrit (3) At the login profile picker page, choose pkasting@chromium.org
Problem 1: Instead of doing anything useful, I get redirected back to the same profile picker page.
(4) Choose pkasting@chromium.org again
Problem 2: Now I end up at myaccount.google.com instead of Skia Gold.
(5) Go back to step (2). If I make the same profile choices, the same result will happen as above. So, instead, choose pkasting@google.com. I don't recall for sure, but I think this may also exhibit problems 1 and/or 2. But eventually, if I do it enough, I wind up at Skia Gold.
This set of issues has persisted for a long time, but it seems like I used to be able to eventually get in with my chromium.org account. Now I can't seem to do it at all.

entry.title: Regression: Headless is trying to use Proprietary video codecs by default
entry.content:
Bisect RANGE: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/d0df26553773add67138d8fbf1bfc9edb4f8d7d4..a0295f6b8caaffb87654f8fbf0b5feb5cc0872a9
Upstream CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5437174
Repro: Navigate to https://www.w3schools.com/html/mov_bbb.mp4 with the headless browser
Regression: Timeout / hangs
Looks like that we before returned `false` in `content::ContentRendererClient overrides` because we ended up [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/base/supported_types.cc;l=356;drc=2a5aaed0ff3a0895c8551495c2656ed49baf742c). And now on the bots we return `true` because we end up [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:headless/lib/renderer/headless_content_renderer_client.cc;l=44-51) and override the method.
Maybe fallback to [IsDefaultSupportedVideoType](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/base/supported_types.cc;drc=2a5aaed0ff3a0895c8551495c2656ed49baf742c;l=350) like it was before if the CLI arg wasn't specified?

entry.title: save >1 group-by-origin context
entry.content:
Add a Finch feature to configure the number of previously-used group-by-origin contexts to keep in case they can be reused.
The context re-use rate plummeted after we introduced prioritization of interest groups -- to combat this, keep contexts for up to n origins.

entry.title: window.frames[name] sometimes return non-window object (e.g. returns HTMLIFrameElement)
entry.content:
- Chrome Version: 123.0.6312.107 (Official Build) (arm64) - OS: macOS Version 14.4.1 (Build 23E224)
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Include some named iframes in window 2. Call `window.frames['name']`
What is the expected result? - `window.frames['name']` should return `Window` object
What happens instead? - `window.frames['name']` returns `HTMLIFrameElement`.
------------ Additional info:
This bug is found by debugging some issues related to gapi. More details in More details in https://b.corp.google.com/issues/316175795#comment18 and go/gapi-find-target-frame-issue
- I couldn't reliably reproduce this behavior. The only way I can reproduce is to open internal google doc (any doc) and call `window.frames['hfcr']`. - Another similar bug is when non-iframe elements like `div` has `id` attribute conflict with `name` attribute in `iframe`, `window.frames[name]` sometimes would return `HTMLDivElement`. https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4FcugFT9MfUQaEj

entry.title: Add a virtual WPT to test ancestor chain bit behavior
entry.content: Add a virtual WPT to cover the ancestor chain bit behavior until AncestorChainBitEnabledInPartitionedCookies is enabled by default.

entry.title: Implement Android support for Dawn's OpenGLES backend
entry.content:
Implement Android support for Dawn's OpenGLES backend
In order to support WebGPU/Compat on devices without Vulkan support, enable the Dawn OpenGLES backend in Chrome on Android. This will require adding support for GLES in AHardwareBufferImageBacking::ProduceDawn().

entry.title: "Manage your Google Account" is vertically truncated in avatar menu
entry.content:
As shown in first attachment, the text "Manage your Google Account" in the avatar menu is wrapped & vertically truncated.
chrome://settings/appearance "font size" is "Medium (recommended)" (2nd screenshot). chrome://settings/fonts is in 3rd screenshot.
Chrome 123.0.6312.105 on Linux.
